basics.name: Anubhav Sen
basics.label: Global Data Operations Intern @ Merck | Computer Engineering Junior Student
basics.summary: An adventurous, curious, and creative fellow that's always ready for the next big challenge! üòÅ

work.name: Merck Sharp & Dohme
work.summary: Global Data Management & Standards (GDMS), Global Data Operations (GDO): Support strategic and operational projects related to process, medical coding, technologies, and data analysis in clinical data management. Working alongside experienced members of the team, the successful candidate will assist with special projects, analyze and evaluate processes, and propose innovative resolutions.

work.name: The Pennsylvania State University
work.position: Part Time ‚Äî Student ‚Äî Computer Science Grader & Learning Assistant for CMPSC 132
work.summary: Assisted my former computer science instructor in mentoring a class of 400+ students in a beginner's level data structures class (CMPSC 132). Administered and proctored exams to create a fair, secure testing environment for all students. Graded students' homework assignments, labs, and exams, providing helpful feedback on areas to improve. Faciliated two recitations of 50 students and held 6 hours of office hours on a weekly basis to clarify concepts and help struggling students achieve mastery of the material.

courses: General Physics: Wave Motion and Quantum Physics (PHYS 214)
Honors Calculus with Analytic Geometry II (MATH 141H)
Object Oriented Programming with Web-Based Applications (CMPSC 221)
Programming and Computation II: Data Structures (CMPSC 132)

awards.title: Student Engagement Network (SEN) Grant Awardee
awards.summary: The SEN grant program is a competitive program aimed at providing funding for students who wish to learn outside the classroom, either by studying abroad, spearheading their own initiative, etc. With this program, I received funding for $2,000 to help with popularizing Nittany Retails around our campus. (Please be aware that the app is currently down from the app stores because of improvements that I'm making right now after talking with some students who downloaded the app before.)

awards.title: The President Walker Award
awards.summary: Awarded to undergraduate students who have earned a 4.0 cumulative grade-point average based on at least 12 credits completed during their first semester.

awards.title: AP Scholar with Distinction
awards.summary: "Granted to students who receive an average score of at least 3.5 on all AP Exams taken, and scores of 3 or higher on five or more of these exams."

awards.title: 2021 Congressional App Challenge
awards.summary: An annual, district-specific challenge to create and submit your own original apps. Each winning app is put on display in the U.S. Capitol Building for a year. For this challenge, I entered my previously-developed Android app TalkZone.

publications.name: Java: A Comprehensive Guide (Part I)
publications.summary: Learning the ins and outs of a new language is no easy task especially when it's an object-oriented computer programming language like Java: hundreds of unfamiliar concepts and rules and words, an entirely different structure than that of our everyday spoken language, not to mention the high potential for embarrassment are enough to intimidate many of us. But don't worry ‚Äî that's why I wrote this guide for people like you. Consisting of a detailed, foundational Java module and several practice problems on each topic, Java: A Comprehensive Guide is ideal for any student (or curious learner) interested in learning more about Java, studying before a final exam, or even preparing for a coding interview at a software company. A rigorous technical treatment, this book includes topics such as primary data structures, conditional statements, loops, arrays, graphics, interfaces, trees, sets, maps, and much more!

publications.name: Java: A Comprehensive Guide (Part II)
publications.summary: Learning the ins and outs of a new language is no easy task especially when it's an object-oriented computer programming language like Java: hundreds of unfamiliar concepts and rules and words, an entirely different structure than that of our everyday spoken language, not to mention the high potential for embarrassment are enough to intimidate many of us. But don't worry ‚Äî that's why I wrote this guide for people like you. Consisting of a detailed, foundational Java module and several practice problems on each topic, Java: A Comprehensive Guide is ideal for any student (or curious learner) interested in learning more about Java, studying before a final exam, or even preparing for a coding interview at a software company. A rigorous technical treatment, this book includes topics such as primary data structures, conditional statements, loops, arrays, graphics, interfaces, trees, sets, maps, and much more!

projects.name: mdadm Library for Linear Devices
projects.summary: In Linux, mdadm (Multiple Disk and Device Management) is a utility used to manage software RAID (Redundant Array of Independent Disks) devices, which combines multiple physical disks into a single logical device to increase performance and reliability. Over the course of a few months, I worked on developing a linear device‚Äîa Non-RAID configuration that concatenates the disks like a normal RAID configuration but without the performance increase and redundancy.

projects.name: CPU Design & Implementation
projects.summary: Throughout the course of the semester, we were tasked with building and designing a five-stage pipelined CPU. Verilog, a hardware description language, was used to write and program the CPU.

projects.name: Nittany Retails
projects.summary: An e-commerce app to trade unused goods and textbooks with students.

projects.name: Smart Planner
projects.summary: A digital student planner app to organize and keep track of assignments/tasks.

projects.name: TalkZone
projects.summary: A video-calling/casting app to cast phone screens to larger television screens instead for a better video-calling experience.

projects.name: TagOut!
projects.summary: An easy-to-use social media app done for fun!

projects.name: Classical Arcade Games
projects.summary: Back in the good ol' days, I built clones of classical video games like Angry Birds, Flappy Bird, Snake, and Tetris using Pygame, an open-source Python package created for developing arcade games.
